action.action-desc: Mr. Pappas (for himself and Mr. Mann) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to make certain improvements to the Office of Accountability and Whistleblower Protection of the Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Strengthening Whistleblower Protections at the Department of Veterans Affairs Act.

section.header: Counsel of Office of Accountability and Whistleblower Protection
section.text: Subsection (e) of section 323 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting (1) before The Office; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

The Assistant Secretary shall appoint a Counsel of the Office, who shall be a career appointee in the Senior Executive Service and shall report to the Assistant Secretary. The Counsel shall provide the Assistant Secretary with legal advice on all matters relating to the Office. In accordance with subsection (e), the Assistant Secretary may hire the appropriate staff for the Counsel to provide such legal advice.

section.header: Modifications to functions of Office of Accountability and Whistleblower Protection
section.text: Subsection (c)(1) of such section is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subparagraphs (A) and (B);
by redesignating subparagraphs (C) through (G) as subparagraphs (A) through (E), respectively;
in subparagraph (A), as so redesignated, by inserting and allegations of whistleblower retaliation after disclosures;
by striking subparagraph (B), as so redesignated, and inserting the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: Referring employees of the Department to the Office of Special Counsel so the Office of Special Counsel may receive whistleblower disclosures and allegations of whistleblower retaliation.

paragraph.text: by striking subparagraphs (H) and (I).

subsection.text: Section 731(c) of such title is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1)—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting , or threatening to take or fail to take, after failing to take; and
in subparagraph (A), by inserting , or with respect to an allegation of such a disclosure before the semicolon; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3), by inserting , making a referral to boards of licensure, after negative peer review.

subsection.header: Function of Office of Accountability and Whistleblower Protection
subsection.text: Section 323(g) of such title is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: The term prohibited personnel action has the meaning given such term in section 731(c) of this title.

section.header: Tracking and enforcement of recommendations and settlement agreements regarding whistleblowers
section.text: Subsection (c) of section 323 of such title, as amended by section 4, is further amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by adding at the end the following new subparagraphs:

subparagraph.text: Tracking the negotiation, implementation, and enforcement of settlement agreements entered into by the Secretary regarding claims of retaliation, including with respect to the work of the General Counsel of the Department regarding such settlements.
Tracking the determinations made by the Special Counsel regarding claims of retaliation, including—

clause.text: any disciplinary action for the individual who engaged in retaliation; and
the need for, and scope of, the Secretary to enter into a settlement agreement with the whistleblower.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: In carrying out subparagraph (I) of paragraph (1), the Assistant Secretary shall, in consultation with the General Counsel, establish metrics and standards regarding—

clause.text: the timely negotiation and implementation of settlement agreements entered into by the Secretary regarding retaliation; and
reasonable restitution and restoration of employment, and other relief for whistleblowers.

subparagraph.text: The Assistant Secretary shall establish a secure electronic system to carry out subparagraphs (I) and (J) of paragraph (1) in a manner that ensures the confidentiality of the identity of a whistleblower.

section.text: Section 323 of such title is further amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (c)(2), by striking receive anonymous whistleblower disclosures and inserting provide information to employees of the Department regarding the rights of and procedures for whistleblowers;
by redesignating subsection (g) as subsection (i); and
by inserting after subsection (f) the following new subsections:
develop, in consultation with the Special Counsel, annual training on whistleblower protection and related issues;
provide and make such training available to employees of the Department; and

disseminate training materials and information to employees on whistleblower rights, whistleblower disclosures, and allegations of whistleblower retaliation, including any materials created pursuant to section 733 of this title.

section.text: Subsection (f) of section 323 of such title is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1)(B)(ii), by striking subsection (C)(1)(G) and inserting subsection (c)(1)(E);
in paragraph (2)—

subparagraph.text: by striking under subsection (c)(1)(I) and inserting by the Special Counsel; and
by inserting not later than 60 days after such date before the Secretary shall; and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

Not later than June 30, 2023, and semiannually thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to the Committees on Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives and the Senate a report on settlements described in paragraph (1)(I) of subsection (c), including, with respect to the period covered by the report—

subparagraph.text: the number of settlements initiated, the disposition of each settlement that was resolved, and the number of settlements that are pending or have not been implemented;
the status of each such pending settlement, including any progress or lack of progress toward settlement and the implementation of such a settlement;
a description of the metrics described in paragraph (4)(A) of such subsection; and
identification of settlement agreements that are not meeting such metrics and standards, or for which there has been any breach of the agreement.
